metadata.title: CVE-2022-21123 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Incomplete cleanup of multi-core shared buffers for some Intel(R)Processors may allow an authenticated user to potentially enableinformation disclosure via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-21123` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

intel-microcode - 3.20220510.0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-187-generic - 4.15.0-187.198
linux-image-4.15.0-187-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-187.198
linux-image-4.15.0-187-lowlatency - 4.15.0-187.198
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-187-generic - 4.15.0-187.198
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-187-lowlatency - 4.15.0-187.198
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-120-generic - 5.4.0-120.136~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-120-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-120.136~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-120-lowlatency - 5.4.0-120.136~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-120-generic - 5.4.0-120.136~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-120-lowlatency - 5.4.0-120.136~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1122-kvm - 4.15.0-1122.127
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: intel-microcode package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20220510.0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-187.198').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-120.136~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1122.127').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1136.147').
